title: Guado al Melo 2016 Rute  (Bolgheri)
description: There are inviting aromas of dark-skinned berry, bay leaf and a hint of ginger in this 80% Cabernet Sauvignon and 20% Merlot blend. The savory, balanced palate delivers ripe blackberry, star anise and a touch of espresso alongside fine-grained tannins.

title: Hawley 2015 Oehlman Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Rich and fruity, this is a lovely, satisfying wine that's medium bodied and salty in oak. Asian five spice and cola dominate alongside black pepper and cinnamon, the dark cherry and strawberry dense and balanced.

title: Heffernan 2013 VV Cabernet Sauvignon (Alexander Valley)
description: Thick and dusty in leathery tannins, this is a robust, well-built wine, exhibiting a wealth of varietal character, from cedar and pencil to black currant and cranberry. It finishes on lingering impressions of bright acidity and spice.

title: Helioterra 2015 Björnson Vineyard Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: A limited (two barrel) vineyard selection, this offers mixed citrus and berry fruit, principally oranges and raspberries. It's set up by refreshing natural acidity, and finished with a broad streak of milk chocolate. All in all it's ready for near-term enjoyment and medium-term aging.

title: Iris Vineyards 2015 Chalice Estate Chardonnay (Willamette Valley)
description: Not to be confused with the winery's Areté reserve version of this same wine, this offers considerable pleasure at a lower cost. The steely core of ripe tree fruits is cloaked in pretty toast. A classic combination for many domestic Chardonnays, here supported with Oregon's exceptional natural acidity. In the resonant finish you'll note a hint of honeycomb.

title: JCP Maltus 2015 Château Teyssier  (Saint-Émilion)
description: Ripe, soft and fruity, this is a delicious, accessible wine. It has red-berry fruits, soft integrated tannins and ripe fruitiness. This wine will develop quickly and easily. Drink from 2019.

title: Kuentz-Bas 2016 Trois Châteaux Auxerrois (Alsace)
description: Only the slightest hints of lemon and bruised apple reach the nose. The palate has the same combination of very lithe lemon overtones on an earthy, light palate with notes of bruised apple flesh. This is dry, fresh and light and very moreish in an unusual, earthy but authentic way.

title: Ledger David 2014 Syrah (Rogue Valley)
description: Syrah continues to be a core strength among this winery's reds. Firm varietal flavors combine in a well-integrated wine, bursting with brambly blackberry, vanilla, coffee and black pepper highlights. The tannins are chewy yet ripe, showing a decent amount of power.

title: Leeuwenkuil 2015 Grenache (Swartland)
description: This is a dense, dark and well-concentrated wine, with abundant notes of blackberry, boysenberry and cherry on the nose and mouth. Hints of pepper, licorice and char add depth and interest, featuring most prominently on the finish alongside a hint of fudgy brownie. The mouthfeel is bold, gripping and firmly textured. Drink now–2021.

title: Leoness 2014 Alessandro Vineyard Syrah (Temecula Valley)
description: This is proving to be one of the more distinctive vineyards in the region, set in the De Luz hills to the west of the valley floor. Aromas of charred hickory and cherry wood meet with black cherry juice, roasted meats and campfire aromas on the nose. The palate shows licorice, hoisin, star anise and a slight gamy quality.

title: Lismore 2015 Syrah (Cape South Coast)
description: Medium-intense black cherry and brambly berry aromas set the stage for this lushly fruited red, with supporting tones of cocoa, tea leaf and tree bark. Clean and well-balanced, the medium-weight palate offers ample acidity and soft, accessible tannins. Drink now–2021.

title: Maison Roy 2015 Petite Incline Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: Fleshy strawberry and cherry fruit carries some phenolic bite. The tannins have a slightly granular feel. The fruit is dappled with dried herbs and the finish threaded with smoke. This young winery is the project of second generation Beaux Frères founders Jared Etzel and Marc-André Roy.

title: Maurice Schoech & Fils 2016 Vieilles Vigne Pinot Auxerrois (Alsace)
description: There is an intriguing floral streak on the otherwise subdued nose. The palate is dry and has a pithy, zesty and slightly bitter edge that gives structure and weight to this concentrated wine.

title: Merry Edwards 2014 Olivet Lane Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: Dark gold in color, this is from a fantastic, famous vineyard site in the heart of the appellation. Confectionery aromas give it a welcoming richness and lush character that's hard to resist. Green olive, vanilla and pineapple shine brightly alongside caramel crème brûlée and toasted oak.

title: Meyer-Fonné 2016 Gentil White (Alsace)
description: Rose petals and ripe, yellow Mirabelle plums create an inviting, appetizing nose. The palate is light, fruity and fresh, with just a dash of gentle, fruit-enhancing sweetness. This is a gentle, easy but aromatic wine, with an off-dry finish.

title: Miles 2006 Medium Dry Tinta Negra Mole (Madeira)
description: This wine is rich, tangy, with a tantalizing poise between dry and sweet. The bite of the acidity and the rich fruits are a good juxtaposition, giving a delicious Madeira that is ready to drink.

title: Naggiar 2015 Estate Grown Petite Sirah (Sierra Foothills)
description: Oodles of fruit flavor and a sense of sweetness give this bold and tannic wine a softer edge than some others. It overflows with blueberry and blackberry aromas, rich fruit flavors and touches of milk chocolate. It will be nice by a campfire or with a chocolate dessert.

title: Nino Negri 2015 Vigneto Fracia  (Valtellina Superiore)
description: Aromas suggesting fruitcake, blue flower and dark spice lead the nose. It's taut and medium-bodied, offering dried cherry, cranberry, sage and clove set against tight, close-grained tannins. Drink 2020–2025.

title: Pittacum 2011 Mencía (Bierzo)
description: While the nose on this well-aged Mencía is damp, earthy and almost nutty smelling, the palate is healthy, with biting tannins. Familiar black-fruit flavors are oaky but not overdone. It tastes saucy and slightly herbal on a racy, intense finish.

title: Podere Conca 2015 Agapanto  (Bolgheri)
description: This blend of Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc and Ciliegiolo opens with aromas of ripe raspberry, baking spice and a hint of violet. The juicy balanced palate doles out red currant, dried black cherry and star anise alongside fine-grained tannins. Drink through 2022.

title: Preiss-Zimmer 2016 Réserve Sylvaner (Alsace)
description: Rather ripe notions of yellow Mirabelle plum join lemon and green pear notes on the nose. On the palate, a lemon note cuts through the slender, lithe but expressive body. The finish is whistle-clean, dry and very refreshing.

title: Quinta das Carvalhas 2013 Late Bottled Vintage  (Port)
description: Dark colored and rich, this smooth wine is poised between sweet and dry. It offers good acidity at the same time as really ripe fruit and a generous texture. This wine, although it is ready to drink, could well age. Drink now or keep until 2020.

title: Riposte 2016 The Dagger Pinot Noir (Adelaide Hills)
description: This is an attractive, easy-going Pinot at an affordable price from winemaker Tim Knappstein. Ripe—very nearly confected—red cherry and strawberry aromas are made more appealing by whispers of tree bark, dried herbs and savory, meaty and smoky components. The medium-bodied palate offers even more bark and medicinal herb characters, finishing on a sappy, black-fruited note.

title: Rivera 2015 Triusco  (Primitivo di Manduria)
description: Vibrant in aromas of spicy cherry, blackberry and wild mint, this Primitivo sees no time in oak, opting for aging in cement tanks. This translates to pure fruit expression on the palate, showing juicy red cherry and strawberry, with flecks of spice, earth and crushed stone adding nuance to the medium-length finish. Lithe in feel, but with proper tannic grip, this is a savory and enticing expression of the variety.

title: Robert Weil 2016 Trocken Gutswein Riesling (Rheingau)
description: Hints of crunchy apricot, apple and pear are juxtaposed by racy streaks of lemon-lime acidity. The palate is more mineral and earth than fruit but elegant and composed, finishing with reverberating lime-zest astringency.

title: Ronco Calino NV Brut  (Franciacorta)
description: Aromas of toast and yellow apple lead the nose on this lively sparkler while the vibrant palate doles out ripe tangerine zest, mature yellow pear and a hint of bitter almond. Fresh acidity and a vivacious perlage buoy up the rich flavors.

title: Ronco Calino NV Satèn  (Franciacorta)
description: Brioche, bread crust and white stone-fruit aromas follow through to the bright palate along with yellow apple and citrus. Fresh acidity and a creamy perlage provide the backdrop while a white almond note signals the close.

title: Salcheto 2013 Riserva  (Vino Nobile di Montepulciano)
description: Subdued aromas of stewed prune, sunbaked earth and a whiff of dark baking spice follow over to the dense fleshy palate, together with hints of licorice and nutmeg. Velvety tannins give it a smooth mouthfeel. Drink sooner rather than later to enjoy the brooding fruit.

title: Summers 2015 Estate Villa Andriana Charbono (Calistoga)
description: This 100% varietal wine is juicy and dusty in concentrated flavors of cinnamon stick and baked plum. Firm tannins support without distraction and give way to a soft lengthy texture of fruit-forward approachability.

title: Thacher 2015 Zinfandel (Paso Robles)
description: Quite impressive for the entry level Zin, this bottling by brewer-turned-winemaker Sherman Thacher shows black currant, loamy soil, vanilla and licorice on the nose. The palate is rounded with black-cherry flavors and minty herbs, proving a cohesive experience.
